page.title: 06BISHOP SUTTON PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: In 1985 the small typical country village school with 69 pupils aged 4 to 11 will be 143 years old.There are 3 classrooms,a small hall,a library,a kitchen which provides school meals and a school house which contains offices & medical room.There is a playing field,an outdoor swimming pool & a yard with a netball court & out- side toilet block.Due to falling rolls a portable class room was recently sold to provide a clubhouse for the village tennis club.Two women teachers commute from Cameley and Pensford;the headmaster from Wells in Somerset.Most pupils live in the village but 5 are brought daily from Stowey and North Widcombe by school bus. At the age of 11 children transfer to Chew Valley Comprehensive School. The very supportive School Society works to provide extra facilities.
